metadata.synopsis: The player tries to talk to a cursed Flaming Fist, who is currently unable to talk. Fist J'ehlar is presently trying to do the same thing, and responds to the player while trying to keep Cullagh in the loop, i.e. doesn't want to talk over his head and tries to include him in the convo.If the player retrieves his Art's dulcimer and plays it, Cullagh can start to come around and wake up.
metadata.how_to_trigger: In Haven walk up to S_SCL_AncientFist_MartCullagh_378938e2-2193-49a3-a06e-8e26cc128055 and click on him.

39.speaker: Halsin
39.text: He keeps saying Thaniel's name - he must know more. We need to rouse him.
39.context: InternalNodeContext: Hasmet answer node from halsin

50.speaker: Halsin
50.text: I saw a winged aasimar fly overhead, and now an assault on Moonrise is brewing - time is not on our side, I fear. We find Thaniel soon.

304.speaker: Halsin
304.text: It's true then; he's met Thaniel - there's no other way he'd know that name. This is just what we needed - well done.

163.speaker: Halsin
163.text: We need to wake him and learn what he knows - change is afoot ever since that winged aasimar tore through the skies above us.

211.speaker: Halsin
211.text: An assault on Moonrise is brewing - time is not on our side, I fear. We find Thaniel soon.

148.speaker: Halsin
148.text: We need to wake him. He must know something about where to find Thaniel.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: I found a lute. It seems to have belonged to the Flaming Fist.

136.speaker: Halsin
136.text: Good - its music might help restore him. Show it to him.

313.speaker: Player
313.text: He had a writ - it mentions the House of Healing.

156.speaker: Halsin
156.text: See what you can learn from it. It might reveal something about his actions before the curse - then we may find means to wake him.

150.speaker: Halsin
150.text: If he was able to escape the Shadowfell, then it mustn't have managed to consume his spirit - not all of it, anyway.

174.speaker: Halsin
174.text: We need to unlock whatever's left of him, inside his head. There must be something to trigger him - a word, a memory, an item. We just need to find it.

242.speaker: Player
242.text: Sounds like we could be looking for almost anything to wake him.

215.speaker: Halsin
215.text: I'm afraid so, yes. Check his person - there might be something on him to help get us started.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: There must be another way to lift the curse.

325.speaker: Halsin
325.text: Without Thaniel, no. And I don't know how I can find him without speaking to this man.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: I'll see what I can do.

294.speaker: Halsin
294.text: I don't deserve you, my friend.

22.speaker: Art Cullagh
22.text: Any word on Thaniel? Is he all right? Is he safe?

227.speaker: Player
227.text: He's at my camp right now - he's going to be fine.

208.speaker: Art Cullagh
208.text: That's more hope than I've had in, well, a century. I'll take it - thank you. Thank you so much.

250.speaker: Art Cullagh
250.text: I haven't been able to sleep, knowing he was trapped in that wretched place.
250.context: NodeContext: slightly haunted, but still relieved that thaniel is safe

278.speaker: Art Cullagh
278.text: Thank you - for saving him when I couldn't. I can rest now... finally.
278.context: NodeContext: weary, closing his eyes as he lays down fully

205.speaker: Player
205.text: Yes, now promise to stop talking about him.
205.context: NodeContext: absolute relief and gratitude - his friend is safe

243.speaker: Art Cullagh
243.text: He is? Oh, thank you. Thank you so much.
243.context: NodeContext: absolute relief and gratitude - his friend is safe

90.speaker: Art Cullagh
90.text: If you'd seen the Shadowfell, seen what hides in that darkness, you'd have been worried too.
90.context: NodeContext: slightly haunted, but still relieved that thaniel is safe

254.speaker: Art Cullagh
254.text: I can finally rest now. It's been too long.
254.context: NodeContext: weary, closing his eyes as he lays down fully

29.speaker: Art Cullagh
29.text: Thank you again, but I need to rest. The curse has left me weak.

37.speaker: Art Cullagh
37.text: It's almost over. Do you feel it? The nightmare is almost over.

49.speaker: Art Cullagh
49.text:
We are fearsome, black and red...
We are living, they are dead...

52.speaker: Art Cullagh
52.text:
We see shadows, they get darker...
But our hiding place is brighter...

64.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
64.text: Please, if you have any idea how to get through to him...

92.speaker: Art Cullagh
92.text:
Mm, mm, Thaniel and me...
Waiting for the sun forever...
92.context: InternalNodeContext: Player has informed Art that Halsin won't be coming. This is Art's hasmet. Quest is effectively over at this point.NodeContext: not technically song lyrics but same breathy, eerie voice as he half sings these lines

99.speaker: Art Cullagh
99.text: Thaniel and me... Thaniel and me... Thaniel...
99.context: InternalNodeContext: Player has informed Art that Halsin won't be coming. This is Art's hasmet. Quest is effectively over at this point.NodeContext: not technically song lyrics but same breathy, eerie voice as he half sings these lines

146.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
146.text: Flame Cullagh - that's your name, isn't it? Art Cullagh? I'm Fist J'ehlar.
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Art, who is lying on a bed, catatonic, faintly and listlessly humming a tune

38.speaker: Art Cullagh
38.text:
Mm, mm, Thaniel and me are...
Climb, climb, climbing up a tree...
38.context: InternalNodeContext: This is a short refrain from a song Art knows

183.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
183.text: We... we need you, sir. One of our own's been taken - a Grand Duke. You might know something that could help us bring him back.
183.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Art, who is lying on a bed, catatonic, faintly and listlessly humming a tune

94.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
94.text: We found him out in the shadows, just...wandering. Nothing survives out there for long. Don't know how he made it, or where he came from...
94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressing playerNodeContext: Hushed incredulity. Art survived in the most unlikely of circumstances.

263.speaker: Narrator
263.text: *This is no physical ailment, it is a spiritual malaise. The man's mind has been gripped by the Shadowfell... yet it has not broken.*
263.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player peering at Art, thinking

110.speaker: Player
110.text: I've heard the name 'Thaniel' from a friend of mine - Halsin.
110.context: NodeContext: speaking to the player at the beginning and then bending to gently speak to the unconscious art

75.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
75.text: Really? Could you bring him here? You'd be glad of the help, wouldn't you, sir?
75.context: NodeContext: speaking to the player at the beginning and then bending to gently speak to the unconscious art

181.speaker: Player
181.text: That name he mentioned - 'Thaniel'. Who is that?
181.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

178.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
178.text: No idea, I'm afraid. Whoever it is, must be someone important to him. He's been saying the same thing over and over, ever since we found him...

266.speaker: Player
266.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

132.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
132.text: You hear me, don't you, sir? You might not be able to answer, but you hear me.

151.speaker: Player
151.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

16.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
16.text: A century locked inside a Sharran curse will do things to a man.

269.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
269.text: But you're not alone, sir. We're here with you. And I'm sure you've got relations, maybe some long-lived friends, even, who'll want to be seeing you.

238.speaker: Player
238.text: Let me have a look at him.
238.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

301.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
301.text: If you know how to get through to him, don't hesitate.
301.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

135.speaker: Player
135.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

164.speaker: Narrator
164.text: *The patient is physically well, but psychologically detached, dissociated from himself.*
164.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *The patient is physically well, but psychologically detached, dissociated from himself.*
43.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

185.speaker: Player
185.text: He's been in the Shadowfell. All memories will have been stripped away. We need to remind him who he is - some personal effects, maybe.
185.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

220.speaker: Shadowheart
220.text: He's been in the Shadowfell. All memories will have been stripped away. We need to remind him who he is - some personal effects, maybe.
220.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

120.speaker: Shadowheart
120.text: His mind lingers in the Shadowfell, but perhaps it can be returned. We need to remind him who he is - some personal effects, maybe.
120.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

172.speaker: Player
172.text: Lost in the shadows all this time... he must have left some part of himself behind. Something we can use.
172.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

283.speaker: Player
283.text: Lost in the shadows all this time... he must have left some part of himself behind. Something we can use.
283.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

277.speaker: Gale
277.text: Lost in the shadows all this time... he must have left some part of himself behind. Something we can use.
277.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

6.speaker: Player
6.text: You're a musician, aren't you, Art.
6.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

59.speaker: Player
59.text: You're a musician, aren't you, Art.
59.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

209.speaker: Player
209.text: You're a musician, aren't you, Art.
209.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

134.speaker: Art Cullagh
134.context: NodeContext:  word is kind of broken up as he mumbles the word

289.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
289.context: NodeContext: Encouraging, trying to encourage Art to wake up

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Did you already check for personal effects?
80.context: NodeContext: Pats pockets or otherwise indicates something isn't where it should be

153.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
153.text: This was in his pocket. He doesn't seem to have any reaction to it now, but he held on to it for a hundred years, anyway.
153.context: NodeContext: Pats pockets or otherwise indicates something isn't where it should be

5.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
5.text: We found a letter in his pocket. - I can't seem to find it now, but  he doesn't seem to have any reaction to it anyway. Held onto it for a hundred years, though.
5.context: NodeContext: Pats pockets or otherwise indicates something isn't where it should be

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Flame Cullagh - do you know where you are?

247.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
247.text: If he does, he isn't saying.

302.speaker: Player
302.text: Pull out the lute you found and play a little.

186.text: Thaniel! He's still trapped there - he needs help!

221.speaker: Art Cullagh
221.text: Thaniel! He's still trapped there - he needs help!
221.context:
CinematicNodeContext: He bolts upright at the sound of the lute. Player puts the lute down on the ground.NodeContext: <GL> rerecord with a sudden snap to awake, He is panicked about Thaniel. Old read was too gradual.
sits bolt upright in bed, shocked and afraid - breathless

314.text: Calm. Breathe. You've been trapped in the Shadowfell for a century - take a moment to clear your mind.

13.speaker: Halsin
13.text: Calm. Breathe. You've been trapped in the Shadowfell for a century - take a moment to clear your mind.

111.speaker: Art Cullagh
111.text: A century... you're Halsin. Thaniel said to find you. You must help him - please.
111.context: NodeContext: Dawning recognition - he's seen Halsin before, a long time ago.

206.speaker: Halsin
206.text: I will, but I need to know where Thaniel is. If I venture into the Shadowfell blind, I will never find him.
206.context: NodeContext: Thinking, trying to articulate something

286.speaker: Art Cullagh
286.text: I'm not sure I can put it into words - the landscape there shifts and changes.
286.context: NodeContext: Thinking, trying to articulate something

318.speaker: Player
318.text: Was there anything that could offer guidance? Something that didn't change?
318.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lays down on the bed tiredlyNodeContext: Relieved he remembered something. Laying back down on the bed as he says it - exhausted

184.speaker: Player
184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lays down on the bed tiredlyNodeContext: Relieved he remembered something. Laying back down on the bed as he says it - exhausted

244.speaker: Player
244.text: Don't tell me I brought you back for nothing.
244.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lays down on the bed tiredlyNodeContext: Relieved he remembered something. Laying back down on the bed as he says it - exhausted

252.speaker: Halsin
252.text: Patience. He's the key to this - I know it.
252.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lays down on the bed tiredlyNodeContext: Relieved he remembered something. Laying back down on the bed as he says it - exhausted

262.speaker: Art Cullagh
262.text: Lavender. Whenever I saw Thaniel, I always smelled lavender.
262.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lays down on the bed tiredlyNodeContext: Relieved he remembered something. Laying back down on the bed as he says it - exhausted

130.text: I can work with that. Rest now.

53.speaker: Halsin
53.text: I can work with that. Rest now.

287.speaker: Halsin
287.text: We have what we need to proceed, and not a moment too soon - a winged aasimar flew overhead, and now an assault is brewing against Moonrise.

223.speaker: Halsin
223.text: I still need your help. Meet me by the lakeshore, and be prepared. What comes next could prove... perilous.

125.speaker: Halsin
125.text: Meet me by the lakeshore. I have what we need to proceed, but I'll need your help. Be ready, this may prove... perilous.

260.speaker: Art Cullagh
260.text: My lute. You got it back. How?
260.context: NodeContext: gathering himself mentally, shocked and almost disbelieving

199.speaker: Player
199.text: I killed Malus Thorm, a twisted surgeon, and took it from his corpse.
199.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid for his friend

65.speaker: Art Cullagh
65.text: You killed a Thorm? They're Ketheric's elite, how did you - never mind. He needs us, needs our help.
65.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid for his friend

27.speaker: Art Cullagh
27.text: I've been lost in the shadows so long. And I met a boy there too - Thaniel. He's the only reason my mind survived that emptiness, that... loss.
27.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid for his friend

173.speaker: Art Cullagh
173.text: He told me about someone he knew. Someone called 'Halsin' -  a druid. Thaniel spoke of little else.
173.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid for his friend

23.speaker: Art Cullagh
23.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid for his friend

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Depends. Why do you want him?
79.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid for his friend

103.speaker: Art Cullagh
103.text: The pull of the darkness, the twisted creatures it manifests - you've seen it, right? Felt it? We can end it. Find Thaniel - Halsin knows how.

295.speaker: Player
295.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid for his friend

26.speaker: Art Cullagh
26.text: He's an expert on the curse. He was here when it all began, Thaniel said.

212.speaker: Art Cullagh
212.text: Thaniel is more than a boy, you see. He's the spirit of the land. Without the druid, without Halsin, Thaniel is trapped - and the curse cannot be lifted.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: I'll bring Halsin - he told me about Thaniel, about the spirit of the land.
171.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid for his friend

245.speaker: Art Cullagh
245.text: I was freed to find you. It's fate. You and I we were meant to meet - to save Thaniel.

264.speaker: Art Cullagh
264.text: Bring Halsin as soon as you can. The Shadowfell is no place for a child. Especially a child like Thaniel.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I know Halsin. I can bring him soon.
30.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid for his friend

231.speaker: Art Cullagh
231.text: Please - hurry! Thaniel is more than just a boy - he's the spirit of the land. And he's all alone.

83.speaker: Art Cullagh
83.text: Without him, the curse won't lift. He said Halsin could help. Find Halsin - please.

187.speaker: Player
187.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid for his friend

106.speaker: Player
106.text: I'm afraid Halsin was left in a goblin camp - he can't come.
106.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid for his friend

1.speaker: Art Cullagh
1.text: What?! But... Thaniel said he could save him. He knew the way. Only he knew the way.
1.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid for his friend

157.speaker: Player
157.text: Isn't there anything else we can do?

54.speaker: Art Cullagh
54.text: No. Thaniel is more than a boy, you see. He's the spirit of the land.

72.speaker: Art Cullagh
72.text: And without the druid, Thaniel is trapped - and the curse can never be lifted.

42.speaker: Art Cullagh
42.text: He saved me, and all I can do is sit here while he suffers, alone and afraid. I'm useless. Useless.
42.context: NodeContext: distress and worried about his friend

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I can't help you. But I've done a great deal for you already.
0.context: NodeContext: trying to be grateful but worried about his friend

320.speaker: Art Cullagh
320.text: Aye. You've brought me back to myself. I wasn't sure it was still possible.
320.context: NodeContext: trying to be grateful but worried about his friend

276.speaker: Art Cullagh
276.text: But the Shadowfell is a place of loss. Pain. It's no place for a child. No place for a child like him.
276.context: NodeContext: distress and worried about his friend

161.speaker: Player
161.text: I had to slay a monster or two.

177.speaker: Art Cullagh
177.text: If you can take on monsters, you can help him - you must, please.

182.speaker: Player
182.text: Don't worry about that now. I'm glad to see you well.

142.speaker: Art Cullagh
142.text: I might be all right, but Thaniel isn't. Not by a long shot.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: Search his body for any indication of a preferred instrument.
168.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kneels and examines the body

117.speaker: Player
117.text: He seems musically-inclined. Look him over for any related clues.
117.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kneels and examines the body

322.speaker: Narrator
322.text: *You notice the distinctive calluses on the man's hands - the kind only developed from decades of playing the lute.*
322.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kneels and examines the body

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Look closer at him. There may be something you missed.
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kneels and examines the body

279.speaker: Narrator
279.text: *His fingertips sport calluses and toughened skin, as if from manual labour, or a playing a stringed instrument perhaps.*
279.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kneels and examines the body

203.speaker: Narrator
203.text: *His fingertips sport calluses and toughened skin, as if from manual labour, or a playing a stringed instrument perhaps.*
203.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kneels and examines the body

115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kneels and examines the body

237.speaker: Narrator
237.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kneels and examines the body

40.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
40.text: Wait - take this letter. It was in his pocket. He doesn't seem to have any reaction to it now, but it might help.

63.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
63.text: Wait - there's something else. We found a letter in his pocket. He doesn't seem to have any reaction to it now, but it might help. I'd let you look at it, except I must've misplaced it.
63.context: NodeContext: Pats pockets or otherwise indicates something isn't where it should be

233.text: *You notice nothing that might indicate a prognosis.*

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *You notice nothing that might indicate a prognosis.*

297.speaker: Player
297.text: It may be some kind of magical affliction...
297.context: NodeContext: To the tune of the song he was humming

240.speaker: Narrator
240.text: *You can't determine the nature of his ailment.*

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *You can't determine the nature of his ailment.*

234.text: *He's spent a long time in the Shadowfell - a Sharran realm without colour or light. It's had a terrible effect on him.*

214.speaker: Narrator
214.text: *He's spent a long time in the Shadowfell - a Sharran realm without colour or light. It's had a terrible effect on him.*

66.speaker: Player
66.context: NodeContext: To the tune of the song he was humming

290.speaker: Narrator
290.context: NodeContext: To the tune of the song he was humming

45.speaker: Art Cullagh
45.context: NodeContext: To the tune of the song he was humming

97.text: *His mind is a grey haze; you can't make sense of anything through the mist.*

265.speaker: Narrator
265.text: *His mind is a grey haze; you can't make sense of anything through the mist.*

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Repeat what you heard in his mind: 'Thaniel'.
12.context: NodeContext: Perking up at the sound of his name, singing a new bit of hte song, but still not fully present.

284.speaker: Art Cullagh
284.text:
We are living, they are dead...
Two of us safe 'til the end...
284.context: NodeContext: Perking up at the sound of his name, singing a new bit of hte song, but still not fully present.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: He's been wandering the Shadowfell for too long. His mind will be there still.
152.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player, mindmeld vfx

189.speaker: Player
189.text: That song - have you heard it before?
189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player, mindmeld vfx

10.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
10.text: No - not until I met Art, anyway. It seems to be all he remembers.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I'll see what I can discover.

309.speaker: Player
309.text: He's a hopeless case. I wouldn't expect much from him.

210.speaker: Player
210.text: Try to commune with the man's soul.
210.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player, mindmeld vfx

93.speaker: Narrator
93.text: *The tether connecting this man to his soul is stretched taught. You follow it, wading through inky shadows.*
93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player, mindmeld vfx

105.speaker: Narrator
105.text: *The tether connecting this man to his soul is stretched taught. You follow it, wading through inky shadows.*
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player, mindmeld vfx

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *His soul wandering in a dark space. He isn't just lost, but he has lost... An object. Something dear to him. The vision fades.*
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player, mindmeld vfxa

248.text: *The tether connecting this man to his soul is frail as frost. Too frail to be of use to you.*
248.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player, mindmeld vfx

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *The tether connecting this man to his soul is frail as frost. Too frail to be of use to you.*
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player, mindmeld vfx

196.speaker: Player
196.text: Recall your studies... What could be causing this?

188.speaker: Player
188.text: He is damaged beyond repair. Better to put him out of his misery.
188.context: NodeContext: Rebuking the player. Then tenderness toward Art

207.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
207.text: Please. That isn't helpful. Art still has plenty of life in him. He's just been... hurt.
207.context: NodeContext: Rebuking the player. Then tenderness toward Art

35.speaker: Player
35.text: You - Art Cullagh. Note the light of the lamps. The colour of my face. You are not in the Shadowfell anymore.
35.context: NodeContext: Not without sympathy. Referring to a man who was rescued from the Shadowfell - Shar's domain.

9.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
9.text: Do you hear that, sir? You're safe.
9.context: NodeContext: Not without sympathy. Referring to a man who was rescued from the Shadowfell - Shar's domain.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: Poor fool. He resisted the Dark Lady's embrace, and suffered for it. He should have just accepted her.
118.context: NodeContext: Not without sympathy. Referring to a man who was rescued from the Shadowfell - Shar's domain.

324.speaker: Shadowheart
324.text: Poor fool. He resisted the Dark Lady's embrace, and suffered for it. He should have just accepted her.
324.context: NodeContext: Not without sympathy. Referring to a man who was rescued from the Shadowfell - Shar's domain.

154.speaker: Shadowheart
154.text: Poor fool. He resisted the Shadowfell - and suffered all the more for it.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: I've never heard that tune. Might be an original composition.

145.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
145.text: Music's a powerful source of memories. We might be able to bring him around if we find what he used to play.

73.speaker: Gale
73.text: Music's a powerful source of memories. We might be able to bring him around if we find what he used to play.

159.speaker: Art Cullagh
159.text: Now that Thaniel's all right, Halsin can banish the curse from this place. Thaniel spoke it - and now it's coming true.

193.speaker: Art Cullagh
193.text: Thaniel will be so scared there alone. We looked after each other for such a long time. I hope he's all right...

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Halsin found Thaniel  in the Shadowfell, but there's something wrong with him.

48.speaker: Art Cullagh
48.text: Something... wrong? He withstood the shadows for so long; whatever's overcome him now must be something different... something worse.

204.speaker: Art Cullagh
204.text: I trust you and Halsin to help him. He's a sweet soul, Thaniel. I can't wait for you to meet him.

226.speaker: Player
226.text: We've found what was ailing Thaniel. He's going to be all right.

3.speaker: Art Cullagh
3.text: Oh, thank the gods. Maybe I'll even get to see him again, once we're both well.

291.speaker: Art Cullagh
291.context: InternalNodeContext: MART ALONENodeContext: breathy, eerie half-singing

296.speaker: Art Cullagh
296.text:
Mm, mm, Thaniel and me are...
Climb, climb, climbing up a tree...
296.context: InternalNodeContext: MART ALONENodeContext: breathy, eerie half-singing

11.speaker: Art Cullagh
11.text: 'Thaniel', he said. Halsin's young target, yes?
11.context: NodeContext: eyes closed, sounding a little panicked and breathy

32.speaker: Lae'zel
32.text: 'Thaniel', he said. Halsin's young target, yes?

141.speaker: Shadowheart
141.text: Thaniel? We've heard that name before - from Halsin. That's who he's looking for.

24.speaker: Karlach
24.text: That name rings a bell. Halsin mentioned a Thaniel, right? Part of his 'spirit of the land' mission.

281.speaker: Astarion
281.text: Thaniel? Didn't Halsin mention him? Something something spirit of the land?

47.speaker: Wyll
47.text: Thaniel? I know the name. Halsin spoke of him - something about the 'spirit of the land'.

202.speaker: Gale
202.text: Thaniel? That's the very lad - or spiriti - that Halsin needs to find.

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *He seems unaware of you or his surroundings.*
84.context: NodeContext: eyes closed, sounding a little panicked and breathy

275.speaker: Player
275.text: He said a name earlier... Thaniel? Halsin is looking for him.
275.context: NodeContext: eyes closed, sounding a little panicked and breathy

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I know that name. Halsin is looking for Thaniel.
91.context: NodeContext: eyes closed, sounding a little panicked and breathy

14.speaker: Art Cullagh
14.context: NodeContext: eyes closed, sounding a little panicked and breathy

251.speaker: Player
251.text: Repeat what you heard in his mind: 'Thaniel'.

239.speaker: Player
239.text: He's been wandering the Shadowfell for too long. His mind will be there still.

219.speaker: Player
219.text: Pull out Art's lute and play.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Pull out the old lute and play it.

166.speaker: Narrator
166.text: *It's from no songbook you know of - likely an original.*

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *It's from no songbook you know of - likely an original.*

33.text: *You're not sure if you've heard it before.*

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *You're not sure if you've heard it before.*

160.speaker: Narrator
160.text: *Without a reminder of who he is, of what he held dear, his mind will remain lost to the darkness.*

138.speaker: Player
138.text: *Without a reminder of who he is, of what he held dear, his mind will remain lost to the darkness.*

230.speaker: Narrator
230.text: *Without a reminder of who he is, of what he held dear, his mind will remain lost to the darkness.*

143.speaker: Player
143.text: You think you're mad? You think YOU'RE MAD?

282.speaker: Narrator
282.text: *You can only dream of a world where you're a peaceful, harmless, babbling buffoon.*

180.speaker: Player
180.text: Imagine yourself in this half-life. Incapacitated, rambling, gone.

213.speaker: Narrator
213.text: *Are you dreaming of your past... or your future?*

259.speaker: Art Cullagh
259.text:
Mm, mm, Thaniel and me...
Do just what we please, together...

232.speaker: Player
232.text: I'm going to help you, all right?

44.speaker: Art Cullagh
44.text:
Mm, mm, Thaniel and me are...
Climb, climb, climbing up a tree...

197.speaker: Player
197.text: Hum the tune he was singing - try to identify it.

139.speaker: Narrator
139.text: *You consider the cadence of his singing - an instrument would make this song whole.*

257.speaker: Player
257.text: Examine his body for clues as to a preferred instrument.

310.text: *Halsin has spent years studying the shadow curse. Perhaps he will know something that can help.*

201.speaker: Narrator
201.text: *Halsin has spent years studying the shadow curse. Perhaps he will know something that can help.*

312.speaker: Player
312.text: Search for signs of magical influence.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Try to commune with the man's soul.

246.speaker: Player
246.text: Recall your studies... What could be causing this?

299.speaker: Art Cullagh
299.text:
Monsters snuffling and stalking...
In the shade where we are walking...
299.context: NodeContext: Still catatonic, breathy, eerie half-singing

305.speaker: Art Cullagh
305.text: You... you're Halsin. Thaniel said to find you. You must help him - please.

306.speaker: Art Cullagh
306.text: I heard tell of an angel overhead. An angel who could clear the shadows. Imagine.
